prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Will Stefan ever confess he has romantic feelings for me, if so, when?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda Blackwood presents the following list of chart components drawn strictly from horary principles for your query, Melissa Gale, noting that you represent yourself by the Ascendant (28°29 Cancer) and Stefan is signified by the 9th house—with its cusp at 12° Pisces—and its planetary cluster. Each datum is intended for your documentation before further interpretation:

1. Querent’s (Melissa’s) Significators
 a. Ascendant: 28°29 Cancer
  • Aspects of note involving the Ascendant:
   – Neptune trine Ascendant (orb 0°)
   – North Node trine Ascendant (orb 1°)
   – Venus trine Ascendant (orb 1°)
   – Moon square Ascendant (orb 2°)
   – Pluto opposition Ascendant (orb 4°)

2. Stefan’s Representations (9th House and Its Ruler)
 a. 9th House Cusp: 12° Pisces
  • The cusp here is ruled traditionally by Jupiter. (For reference, Jupiter is located at 11°16 Gemini in the chart.)
 b. Planetary Cluster within the 9th House (all in Pisces):
  – Venus: 29° Pisces
  – Saturn: 17° Pisces
  – Neptune: 28° Pisces
  – North Node: 29° Pisces
  • Aspects within the cluster:
   – Venus conjunction North Node (orb 0°)
   – Neptune conjunction North Node (orb 1°)
   – Venus conjunction Neptune (orb 1°)

3. Core Planetary Positions (for context and cross-reference):
 • Sun: 15° Aquarius
 • Moon: 26° Aries
 • Mercury: 11° Aquarius
 • Mars: 19°39 Cancer (retrograde)
 • Jupiter: 11°16 Gemini (retrograde)
 • Uranus: 23°16 Taurus
 • Pluto: 2°08 Aquarius
 • Chiron: 19°35 Aries
 • MC (Midheaven): 11°35 Aries
 • IC (Imum Coeli): 11°35 Libra

4. Additional Significant Aspects (relevant to timing and mutual influences):
 • Moon square Ascendant (orb 2°): Emotion and response activation
 • Mars square Chiron (orb 0°): Indicative of potential wounds impinging on assertive action
 • Mars trine Saturn (orb 2°): Suggests measured energy, possibly delaying abrupt declarations
 • Pluto sextile North Node (orb 3°) and Venus sextile Pluto (orb 3°): Indicate transformative potential in relationship matters
 • Sun sextile MC and Sun sextile Chiron (orb 4°): Link career/public aspects and healing, contextual to external perceptions
 • Sun trine IC and Sun trine Jupiter (orb 4°): Reinforce supportive background energies

5. Relevant Chart Patterns (noted for overall tone):
 a. Grand Trine: Involving the Sun (Aquarius), Mercury (Aquarius), Jupiter (Gemini), and the IC (Libra)
 b. Kite Pattern: Centered on the same Air elements with an extension to the MC in Aries
 c. T-Square: Involving the Ascendant (Cancer), Moon (Aries), and Pluto (Aquarius)
 d. Cradle Formation: Comprising Pluto (Aquarius), Ascendant (Cancer), Uranus (Taurus), and Venus (Pisces)
  • This last pattern emphasizes emotional security but underpins potential complexities in personal expression

6. Timing and Emotional Indicators
 • The Moon, positioned in Aries (26°), suggests rapid shifts in emotion—its square to the Ascendant (2° orb) may imply inner turbulence or a testing of boundaries.
 • The waxing crescent phase of the Moon indicates the early stages of an unfolding process.
 • The close clustering of Stefan’s significators in the 9th (especially the near-perfect conjunctions of Venus, Neptune, and the North Node) points to a concentrated yet potentially obscured influence regarding feelings and their expression.

These components—specifically the configuration of the 9th house cluster representing Stefan, the supportive trines to your Ascendant, and the timing signals provided by lunar aspects and phase—form the essential framework for further interpretation. Melissa Gale, you now have the complete listing of horary data necessary for evaluating the conditions surrounding Stefan’s potential confession of romantic feelings.

Melissa Gale, you now have the complete listing of horary data necessary for evaluating the conditions surrounding Stefan’s potential confession of romantic feelings.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda Blackwood regards the chart with a steady gaze, her voice measured as she outlines the interpretation:

The querent’s Ascendant in Cancer projects openness and nurturing emotion. Noteworthy are the fluid aspects from Neptune, Venus, and the North Node—each in supportive trine to the Ascendant—which indicate that the energy of fate and idealized love is present. The querent’s sincere emotional intent is marked by this alignment, even as the Moon’s square to the Ascendant speaks to inner turmoil and hesitation.

Stefan’s significance, grounded in the 9th house, is shown in a tightly grouped cluster in Pisces: Venus, Saturn, Neptune, and the North Node. Within this cluster, Venus and Neptune conjoin the North Node. Their blended influence reveals that Stefan’s deeper affections exist beneath layers of idealism and uncertainty. Venus here speaks of his inherent attraction and potential for romantic expression; Neptune adds mystery, suggesting that his feelings may be more like a spiritual or fated prompting than a straightforward declaration. Yet Saturn’s presence injects a cautionary, delaying note. He feels the pull of duty and perhaps an internal warning against breaching established boundaries.

The Moon in Aries, charged with emotional urgency, casts its square upon the querent’s Ascendant, hinting that moments of impulsive clarity may punctuate this latent connection. Such dynamic lunar influences typically herald episodes when emotions swell enough to breach self-imposed limits. This tension, combined with the transformative power of the Pluto opposition to the Ascendant, suggests that a breakthrough is possible—but not without significant inner conflict that must be resolved first.

Timing indicators emerge as the Moon’s current waxing crescent phase signals the inception of a process. The energies imply that once the querent’s emotional barriers begin to yield, a fated catalyst—likely triggered by the Moon’s passage over key degrees shared with Stefan’s significators—may impel him toward confession. In horary practice, the active role of the Moon often indicates swift developments following its decisive contacts.

Based on these factors, the chart indicates that Stefan’s confession, if it comes, is less likely to be a slow, prolonged process and more the result of a sudden emotional impetus aligning with the Moon’s cycle in a near-future window. The conjunctions within Stefan’s 9th house cluster, especially the potent Venus–Neptune–North Node alignment, suggest that the confession is fated. However, Saturn’s delay remains a significant factor. The interplay implies that after a period of internal hesitation and when a dynamic lunar transit finally activates the cluster—likely when the Moon nears the degrees in Pisces shared by his cluster—a confession of romantic feeling might occur.

In practical terms, the unfolding indicates a probable confession in the forthcoming cycle of emotionally charged lunar activity. When the Moon makes a significant aspect to the 9th house cluster—possibly within a few weeks to a couple of months—the critical energy may overcome Saturn’s reticence. This transit would act as the necessary trigger for Stefan to finally reveal his deeply held affections.

Madame Esmeralda Blackwood concludes that while the chart affirms the existence of sincere romantic feeling on Stefan’s part, it also shows that the confession will come only after an emotional buildup catalyzed by a decisive lunar transit that directly illuminates the 9th house cluster. This moment of clarity appears fated, though its precise timing depends on the unfolding of the near-term lunar phases activating the degrees in question.

The evidence indicates that a genuine declaration is likely, though it remains subject to the natural release of the emotional tension currently present.

Madame Esmeralda Blackwood regards the chart with a steady gaze, her voice measured as she outlines the interpretation:

The querent’s Ascendant in Cancer projects openness and nurturing emotion. Noteworthy are the fluid aspects from Neptune, Venus, and the North Node—each in supportive trine to the Ascendant—which indicate that the energy of fate and idealized love is present. The querent’s sincere emotional intent is marked by this alignment, even as the Moon’s square to the Ascendant speaks to inner turmoil and hesitation.

Stefan’s significance, grounded in the 9th house, is shown in a tightly grouped cluster in Pisces: Venus, Saturn, Neptune, and the North Node. Within this cluster, Venus and Neptune conjoin the North Node. Their blended influence reveals that Stefan’s deeper affections exist beneath layers of idealism and uncertainty. Venus here speaks of his inherent attraction and potential for romantic expression; Neptune adds mystery, suggesting that his feelings may be more like a spiritual or fated prompting than a straightforward declaration. Yet Saturn’s presence injects a cautionary, delaying note. He feels the pull of duty and perhaps an internal warning against breaching established boundaries.

The Moon in Aries, charged with emotional urgency, casts its square upon the querent’s Ascendant, hinting that moments of impulsive clarity may punctuate this latent connection. Such dynamic lunar influences typically herald episodes when emotions swell enough to breach self-imposed limits. This tension, combined with the transformative power of the Pluto opposition to the Ascendant, suggests that a breakthrough is possible—but not without significant inner conflict that must be resolved first.

Timing indicators emerge as the Moon’s current waxing crescent phase signals the inception of a process. The energies imply that once the querent’s emotional barriers begin to yield, a fated catalyst—likely triggered by the Moon’s passage over key degrees shared with Stefan’s significators—may impel him toward confession. In horary practice, the active role of the Moon often indicates swift developments following its decisive contacts.

Based on these factors, the chart indicates that Stefan’s confession, if it comes, is less likely to be a slow, prolonged process and more the result of a sudden emotional impetus aligning with the Moon’s cycle in a near-future window. The conjunctions within Stefan’s 9th house cluster, especially the potent Venus–Neptune–North Node alignment, suggest that the confession is fated. However, Saturn’s delay remains a significant factor. The interplay implies that after a period of internal hesitation and when a dynamic lunar transit finally activates the cluster—likely when the Moon nears the degrees in Pisces shared by his cluster—a confession of romantic feeling might occur.

In practical terms, the unfolding indicates a probable confession in the forthcoming cycle of emotionally charged lunar activity. When the Moon makes a significant aspect to the 9th house cluster—possibly within a few weeks to a couple of months—the critical energy may overcome Saturn’s reticence. This transit would act as the necessary trigger for Stefan to finally reveal his deeply held affections.

Madame Esmeralda Blackwood concludes that while the chart affirms the existence of sincere romantic feeling on Stefan’s part, it also shows that the confession will come only after an emotional buildup catalyzed by a decisive lunar transit that directly illuminates the 9th house cluster. This moment of clarity appears fated, though its precise timing depends on the unfolding of the near-term lunar phases activating the degrees in question.

The evidence indicates that a genuine declaration is likely, though it remains subject to the natural release of the emotional tension currently present.

mes: Will Stefan ever confess his romantic feelings for me? It's likely, and could be anywhere from two weeks to a few months.
